title: Trump-admiring populist Javier Milei wins Argentina presidential election
summary: The libertarian outsider has frequently been compared to former US President Donald Trump. A self-described anarcho-capitalist, Milei made headlines with his unconventional proposals that include making the US dollar the official currency as a way of ending the scourge of triple-digit inflation.

title: French performers lead a silent Paris march for peace between Israelis and Palestinians
summary: The crowd, which included actresses Isabelle Adjani and Emmanuelle Beart, marched on Sunday from the Arab World Institute toward the Museum of Art and History of Judaism in Paris. France, home to significant Jewish and Muslim populations, has seen weeks of protests and tensions over the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Rosalynn Carter, outspoken former first lady, dead at 96
summary: The Carter Center said the former first lady died Sunday after living with dementia and suffering many months of declining health. Aides to former President Carter sometimes referred to her privately as 'co-president' because of her active role at the White House.

title: In Iceland, the imminent volcanic eruption is also causing concern about the economy
summary: Earthquakes have already caused major damage in the town of Grindavik, in southwest Iceland. Between inflation and air transport chaos, previous disasters have taken their toll on life on the island.

title: Israel-Palestine: A short history of the two-state solution
summary: Born of the UN partition plan for Palestine in 1947, the two-state solution represents the only prospect of a lasting settlement to the current conflict.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: A 'hardcore' summer for transport? What message is the government sending?
summary: French Transport Minister Clément Beaune warned that getting around Paris in the summer of 2024 will be very complicated. Is he telling Parisians that it would be better to stay away during the Games? Many have already decided to leave.

title: At least 21 dead in torrential Dominican Republic rains
summary: Torrential storms over the past 48 hours have caused flooding, damaged infrastructure and brought down houses in the Caribbean nation. President Luis Abinader said it was the 'largest rainfall event ever' in the country's history.

title: Medics evacuate 31 premature babies from Gaza's Al-Shifa hospital, UN says
summary: Hours before the babies were evacuated, the WHO said 291 patients and 25 health workers were still inside the hospital.

title: Mother of teen killed during a traffic stop in France leads a protest against police officer's release
summary: A few hundred people rallied Sunday at the site where Nahel Merzouk was killed in Nanterre after the officer suspected in the fatal shooting was released from custody pending further investigation. Shouts briefly erupted when objects were thrown at police, but the gathering was overall peaceful.

title: Russia's new target? 'Hostile' Finland
summary: The number of asylum seekers at the country's eastern border has suddenly surged. Helsinki denounced the increase as a destabilization operation by Moscow in retaliation for its NATO membership.

title: Greta Thunberg's Gaza stance splits the Fridays for Future climate movement
summary: The Swedish activist, who inspired the movement, has been criticized for taking a stance deemed too pro-Palestinian.

title: French senator suspected of drugging MP pleads 'handling error'
summary: Following a complaint from MP Sandrine Josso, Senator Joël Guerriau was charged with 'administering a substance in order to commit rape or sexual assault.' He was immediately suspended from his party and parliamentary group.

title: Napoleon's hat sells for record €1.9 million at auction
summary: The hat, known as a bicorne, attracted interest from collectors 'the world over,' auctioneers Osenat said. It sold for €1.932 million.

title: Iranian rapper freed after year in jail for backing Mahsa Amini protests
summary: Local media reported Toomaj Salehi was released on bail after publicly backing the wave of demonstrations following the death of Mahsa Amini.

title: Ukrainian teen taken from Mariupol returned home
summary: Bogdan Yermokhin turned 18 on Sunday. Russia had recently issued him a draft summons to report for mandatory military conscription.

title: The rise of the dreaded situationship: 'It's a horrible word, commitment! It sounds like the end of something'
summary: A symptom of the times, more and more 20-somethings prefer to live in a gray area of love rather than declare themselves a couple

title: Ukraine gives swift justice to suspected collaborators in recently liberated areas
summary: Over 7,000 criminal cases have been opened for collaboration. But there's nothing to distinguish teachers, employees or junior administrative staff from Ukrainians who have deliberately sided with Russia.

title: Milipol security exhibit in Paris shows sector is booming as conflicts wage on
summary: The 2023 edition of the Paris-Villepinte international security equipment exhibit attracted a record number of visitors. Growing tensions across the globe are benefiting a booming sector.

title: The first time Le Monde wrote about The Beatles
summary: A new track by the Fab Four was released on November 2, more than 50 years after the band broke up, thanks to artificial intelligence. The Beatles first appeared on the pages of Le Monde on December 12, 1963.

title: Modigliani, a not-so-cursed painter at the Musée de l'Orangerie
summary: Until January 15, 2024, an exhibition in Paris traces the Italian artist's ties with his dealer, Paul Guillaume.

title: The angel reporter for Ciudad Juárez migrants
summary: Based in the Mexican border town, journalist Judith Torrea provides valuable information on her Instagram account for anyone dreaming of entering the US.

title: Macron to spend week on domestic front, touting economy
summary: President Emmanuel Macron will spend much of the week selling his industrial policy, with a plan to help SME exports, agreements with the largest polluters on cutting emissions, and an investment from the Danish pharmaceutical  company Novo Nordisk.

title: Tesla consolidates its dominance of the electric car market against American and European manufacturers
summary: The price war strategy may have limited the profits of the Elon Musk co-founded automotive group, but it has enabled Tesla to flood Europe and the USA with its models.

title: Yemen rebels say seized vessel owned by Israeli businessman
summary: Houthi rebels said on Sunday they had seized an Israeli ship which they had rerouted towards the Yemeni coast. But Israel said it was British-owned and that no Israeli nationals were on board.

title: A search for executed German soldiers found no remains, but gave one woman answers
summary: This summer, excavations were carried out in the French village of Meymac to locate the remains of German soldiers who were executed in 1944. Although the searches found nothing, media coverage of the case allowed a German woman to reconstruct the last days of her grandfather's life.

title: World's richest 1% emit as much carbon as poorest 66%
summary: The figures are particularly stark in France, where the richest 1% emit as much carbon in one year as the poorest 50% in 10 years.

title: Three carbon offset projects in Brazil accused of being scams
summary: Many multinational companies bought carbon credits to support forest preservation in Portel, Brazil, in order to offset their CO2 emissions – but it turns out the projects were fraudulent.

title: Inside France's Jewish Community Protection Service
summary: Created in the aftermath of the 1980 Paris synagogue bombing, the Jewish Community Protection Service is in increasing demand due to a rise in anti-Semitic incidents since the 7 October Hamas attack in Israel.

title: Rosalynn Carter, the death of a highly political first lady
summary: Rosalynn and Jimmy Carter had been married since 1946. She played a decisive political and diplomatic role during their time in the White House, between 1977 and 1981.

title: Microsoft hires former OpenAI chief Sam Altman
summary: Altman was fired by OpenAI's board on Friday, before being hired at Microsoft on Monday.

title: Israeli army prepares for ground operation in south of Gaza Strip
summary: Israel, which had asked Gaza's inhabitants to flee to the south of the territory, is preparing to hunt the leaders of Hamas they believe to be there. The director of a hospital in Khan Yunis, in the south, said 26 people were killed in a strike on Friday night.

title: Shock and uncertainty in Argentina after Milei's presidential triumph
summary: The 'anarcho-capitalist' candidate won 55.7% of the vote on Sunday, defeating the current Economy Minister Sergio Massa. He came out on top in 21 of the 24 provinces, making him the best-elected president since the return to democracy in 1983.

title: Thousands united in silence at Paris march for peace
summary: Celebrities and ordinary Parisians marched through the French capital on Sunday, in silent protest against the divisions sown by the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Shakira reaches €7.3 million deal to settle tax fraud case
summary: The Colombian singer agreed to the fine and a suspended sentence over charges that she defrauded the Spanish state of €14.5 million, saying 'winning is getting my time back for my kids and career.'

title: Athens is cutting down trees in Exarcheia to make way for a subway
summary: Residents of one of the Greek capital's famous protest neighborhoods, have been fighting for over a year against the construction of a new subway station in its main square. When workers started to cut down trees, residents were up in arms.

title: Yemeni Houthis open new Red Sea front
summary: On November 19, Houthi rebels in Yemen claimed to have seized a commercial vessel belonging to an Israeli businessman in retaliation for Israel's war against Hamas.

title: Negotiations for the release of Hamas hostages are making progress
summary: The agreement, brokered by Qatar and the United States, could include the release of around 50 of the 240 hostages.

title: French-Palestinians evacuated from Gaza share their stories: 'We were waiting for death'
summary: According to the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 115 people – French nationals, their dependents and the staff of the French Institute – have been repatriated to France from Gaza. They worry about their friends and family still in the enclave.

title: Orphaned Ukrainian teen taken to Russia returns home
summary: Bohdan Yermokhin, who was transported from Mariupol by Russian forces as part of a group of Ukrainian children, was able to return to Ukraine on 19 November – his 18th birthday.

title: Hundreds convicted in historic Italian mafia trial
summary: The culmination of a historic 33-month trial against Calabria's notorious 'Ndrangheta mafia, the court convicted 207 defendants to a total of over 2,000 years in prison.

title: Israel stands united behind its army in war against Hamas
summary: Despite the carnage caused by the airstrikes on Gaza, there are very few dissenting voices in the Jewish state on this military operation's necessity.

title: Joseph Boakai declared President-elect of Liberia
summary: The opposition Unity Party candidate, former Vice President Joseph Boakai defeated incumbent George Weah in the second round of Liberia's presidential election with 50.64% of the vote.

title: Catharine MacKinnon: 'Consent is the main legal and social excuse for doing nothing about sexual coercion'
summary: In French rape trials, the focus is more on the plaintiff's state of mind than on the accused's behavior, explains the American feminist legal scholar, who explains how she has affected the national debate by publishing 'Le Viol redéfini' ('Rape redefined')

title: Tunisian jihadist Abdesalem Lassoued's journey through europe
summary: Italy, France, Portugal, Norway, Sweden and Belgium: Having escaped from Gabes prison during the Tunisian revolution, the killer of two Swedes in Brussels in mid-October had been exploiting security loopholes in the Schengen area for years.

title: A French bishop is accused of attempted rape
summary: This latest scandal to hit the French Catholic Church concerns allegations of attempted rape of an adult man in 2013, who was staying in the facilities of a Catholic group run by the accused.
